glossary.definition: A basic logic gate that outputs true (1) only when all its inputs are true. (Example: If A = 1 and B = 1, output = 1)
A numbering system that represents all numbers using two symbols: 0 and 1. (Example: Decimal 2 in binary is 10)
An electronic component that stores electrical energy in an electric field.
A semiconductor device that allows current to flow in one direction only.
A logic gate that outputs true (1) when the number of true inputs is odd.
The number of times a periodic action occurs in one second.
A basic building block of digital circuits that performs a logical operation.
A base-16 numbering system using digits 0-9 and letters A-F.
A passive electronic component that stores energy in a magnetic field.
The region where two different semiconductor materials meet in a semiconductor device.
